intro: Macrocarpaea wurdackii, commonly known as the Wurdack’s macrocarpa, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, simple, and usually hairy leaves, which are often glandular. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
